description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

description.narrative: A travers le cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires, les partenaires de l’Alliance du Vaccin soutiennent les activités de vaccination au niveau national
Gavi’s targeted country assistance aims to share our partners’ specialist skills with the countries we support

title.narrative: À propos de l’aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative: L’aide ciblée aux pays de Gavi vise à partager les compétences spécialisées de nos partenaires avec les pays que nous soutenons
Through the partners’ engagement framework, Vaccine Alliance partners support countries’ immunisation activities

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

target.value: Support the development of Adverse Events Following Immunisation training (AEFI) manual.

comment.narrative: AEFI platform has been established. AEFI committee members were trained. Following the training of committee members the team continues to be supported using the adopted tools to monitor adverse effects on immunization at different level.

target.value: Support the development of Adverse Events Following Immunisation training (AEFI) manual.

comment.narrative: An international consultant hired, training of trainers conducted and assessment done with participants

title.narrative: Data improvement field activity implemented (review, validation, monitoring, harmonisation, mentorship, workshop, others)

target.value: Hiring of a consultant to support MR Post Campaign Coverage Survey

comment.narrative: Completed with support from WHO data manager, hired consultant and head of AEFI IST/WA and participants

target.value: Hiring of a consultant to support MR Post Campaign Coverage Survey

comment.narrative: Two consultants expected to be hired. Due to COVID-19 the facilitation took place mainly through zoom meetings. Plans are on the way to hire an International consultant to support the country when the campaign starts.

title.narrative: Funds are available subnationally to execute planned activities

comment.narrative: Attended TWG meetings including with technical partners and EPI to monitor HPV vaccination and challenges.

target.value: Participate in Gavi's annual Joint Appraisal (MSD) and grant renewal processes to ensure continuity of HPV TA support

comment.narrative: EPI and TWG shared challenges about HPV implementation in a Covid19 context and has proposed news strategies and activities to restart HPV vaccination and improve data coverage.

target.value: Participate in Gavi's annual Joint Appraisal (MSD) and grant renewal processes to ensure continuity of HPV TA support

comment.narrative: PATH attended the Joint Appraisal meeting virtually in January 2021.

title.narrative: IEC materials printed and distributed countrywide

target.value: Development of locally appropriate graphics and information, education and communication materials for immunization

comment.narrative: IEC materials not yet printed

target.value: Development of locally appropriate graphics and information, education and communication materials for immunization

comment.narrative: IEC materials not yet printed

target.value: Development of locally appropriate graphics and information, education and communication materials for immunization

comment.narrative: The printing has not been done due to competing priorities at ministry of health due to COVID and nOPV vaccination. GAVI SCM has approved reallocation to 2022 for activity implementation

title.narrative: Findings and recommendations from assesment incorporated into regional and national plans for 2020. Increased vaccination coverage for vaccines in 2yl and lower drop-out rates.

target.value: Missed Opportunities for vaccination assesment conducted, supported by operational research particularly for vaccines given in 2YL with high drop out rates

comment.narrative: Funds were transferred to MoH but activity not conducted due to competing priorities.

title.narrative: EVM Assesment conducted and final report available

target.value: Conduct of Effective Vaccine Management (EVM) Assesment 2019 and development of the EVM Improvement Plan

comment.narrative: Not done due to delay in rolling out mobile app and due COVID in 2020

title.narrative: EVM Improvement Plan developed and costed. 80% of immediate recommendations implemented

target.value: Conduct of Effective Vaccine Management (EVM) Assesment 2019 and development of the EVM Improvement Plan

comment.narrative: The EVM could not be conducted in 2019 due to delay in the training of staff on EVM mobile app and the COVID in 2020. However, the implementation of the recommendations from the 2014 EVM is ongoing

title.narrative: Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Hiring of consultant to support Rapid Convenience Monitoring (RCM) implementation during the MR camapign.

comment.narrative: Completed through integration of services by EPI and RMNCAH. Please find attached Continuity of essential services report, AEFI summary training report and the adopted mounting tools from the GAVI reprogrammed funds.

target.value: Hiring of consultant to support Rapid Convenience Monitoring (RCM) implementation during the MR camapign.

comment.narrative: Not yet started.AWAITS THE START OF THE CAMPAIGN.

title.narrative: EPI organogram revised to reflect core functions such as policy and planning, surveillance, vaccine stock management, M&E, fund management

target.value: Support the development of a national immunisation policy.

comment.narrative: Ongoing support for the review and development of the national immunization policy. Engagement of stakeholders started and draft plan made with a request from MoH for partner funding.

title.narrative: Participation in continued dose 2 review meetings completed

target.value: Technical support to MOH to monitor HPV dose 2 implemention progress, identify challenges, propose solutions

comment.narrative: Although PATH was not able to visit the country due to COVID 19, EPI conducted supervision activities to the district level for the 2nd dose implementation. The Gambia organized a mop up vaccination in both communities and schools for increasing HPV coverage and based on feedbacks from the team today activities went well and with high participation of schools and communities. PATH was able to join some TWG meeting and have regular meetings with EPI team to support monitoring HPV dose 2 implementation regarding challenges for increasing HPV coverage in the county level. Additionally, PATH provided support (including financial support) to train village health workers and to conduct readiness assessment for enhancing dose 2 implementation quality.

title.narrative: Improvement plan developed and implemented to reduce zero dose and missing dose children

target.value: Support for developing and implementation coverage improvement plan

comment.narrative: Key findings of the rapid assessment helped to support and implement activities for improving coverage. Catch up have been done in both schools and communities. Country will send updated coverage data soon.

title.narrative: Plan for piloting electronic data into regular data system developed

target.value: Support the EPI for capacity building for data management for HPV and routine vaccines, assist with developing a pilot for electronic vaccination data

comment.narrative: PATH is working on a pilot plan and will share it with Gambia EPI by early December 2021.

title.narrative: Support to and attendance at planning and TWG meetings is completed

target.value: Nat?l planning and TWG meetings for HPV intro (routine+MAC)

comment.narrative: PATH participated in the meetings.

title.narrative: Social mob and communication materials and support available

target.value: Support for social mob and communication materials; adaption of materials and strategy between dose 1 and dose 2 of routine cohort

comment.narrative: PATH supported EPI training for 45 Village Health Workers in low performing areas were oriented and tasked to talk to their community members. Activities has been done after a pre-assessment in districts and communities where dose 1 coverage was low. Communities discussion, communities leaders sensitization on HPV vaccine have been organized in different districts.

target.value: Assist with HPV PIE implementation

comment.narrative: PATH to work with TWG to align on the activities that need support. The PIE activity is still on track and PATH expects to get confirmation dates soon about the start date.

target.value: Assist with HPV PIE implementation
Support for a rapid assessment for HPV and areas of low coverage

comment.narrative: Rapid assessment and village health workers training have ben done to improve HPV coverage in regions.

title.narrative: Performance management support provided to reduce zero dose and missing dose children

target.value: Support for monitoring and supportive supervision of routine HPV delivery and implementation of coverage improvement plan

comment.narrative: The country has conducted an assessment in all the regions with a checklist including micro planning, communications activities plan, cold chain and service delivery to improve HPV coverage. PATH was not able to join the supportive supervision due the Covid 19 spread-out during that moment. After, the assessment activities some key findings have been found, based on that then diverse activities have been implemented in schools and communities. (mob up activities, outreach vaccination in communities and schools, training of village health workers).

target.value: Assist with HPV PIE implementation

comment.narrative: Activity was postponed due to the pandemic. New date is yet to be decided.

target.value: Assist with HPV PIE implementation

comment.narrative: PIE hasn?t been conducted. PATH to work with TWG to align on the activities that need support.
